result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.

Communication/visitation/exchange regarding children to be done through a third party until contact is approved.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr.

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary - Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward
See plea hearing for details as to the waiver.

9:33 AM cases 20CM610, 22CF709 called. Defendant Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense recites the joint agreement. 
In 22CF709: Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Court accepts defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in including uncharged case 22EC2493. Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on probation for 2 years with conditions: 
90 days in Jail with Huber or Electronic Monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate, All stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone. 
No contact with B.W. or her residence without her approval and the probation agent's approval. 
Visitation and exchange to be done through a 3rd party until contact is approved. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

In 20CM610: There is a joint agreement for 6 months in Jail.
Court orders 6 months in Jail with Huber or Electronic Monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate. 
Defendant has 96 days credit.

9:37 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr. not in court.  Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Cassius O.T. Watkins Sr.

Attorney Steuer states that Defendant is currently in custody at the Eau Claire County Jail, but did not request that he be brought over as he is requesting new date.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/24/2022 at 2:45 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
